language-name-romanized:
The '''romanized''' version of the name of '''your''' language. Do not translate this message if your language is written using a Latin alphabet.

'''Important:''' Do not use your language’s word for “English”. Use the word that your language uses to refer to itself. If you translate this message to mean “English” in your language, your change will be reverted.

'''Important:''' This message must be romanized – that is, it should use a Latin alphabet rather than your language’s usual script. If you change this message to a script other than Latin, your change will be reverted.
{{Identical|English}}
language-name-romanized-sorted:
The romanized version of a language name, sorted in alphabetical, left-to-right order, without diacritics. For many languages, a grammatical article or the word for 'language' may normally appear before the language name; move this word to the end for sorting purposes. For example, romanized Arabic is 'Al-ʿArabīyah', whereas the sorted, romanized version is 'Arabiyah, Al'.

'''Important:''' Do not use your language’s word for “English”. Use the word that your language uses to refer to itself. If you translate this message to mean “English” in your language, your change will be reverted.

'''Warning:''' However, you should use the English alphabet (i.e. only A(a) - Z(z) are accepted), even if your language is usually written either with diacritics or in a different script. If you change this message to either with diacritics or a script other than Latin, your change will be reverted.

'''Important:''' This message should be in ASCII if possible. It also should not begin with a word meaning “the” or “language”.
{{Identical|English}}
footer-donate: Text that appears in the footer on www.wikipedia.org. Will be linked to donate.wikimedia.org
license: License text, use https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/deed.(your language code) to show the translation of license.
terms-link: {{Optional}} The URL of the translated Terms of service page. Like https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Terms_of_use/{{UILANGCODE}} but be certain that a translation exists.
privacy-policy-link: {{Optional}} The URL of the translated Privacy policy page. Like https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Privacy_policy/{{UILANGCODE}} but be certain that a translation exists.
other-languages-label: The label of the link to a list of all Wikipedia: [[Special:MyLanguage/List_of_Wikipedias|List of Wikipedias]]

wiki.entries:
The name of a content page on Wikipedia, pluralized. For example, in English: articles.
{{Identical|Article}}
wiki.language-button-text: Text for the language dropdown button
wiki.footer-description: Text that appears beside the sister project links in the footer on www.wikipedia.org

app-links.title: Title of that app link section on wikipedia.org
app-links.description: Description of the Wikipedia mobile apps
app-links.google-store: Title of the Google Play Store
app-links.apple-store: Title of the Apple App Store
app-links.url: The URL of an article that lists all available Wikipedia apps. The link URL should be https://(your language code).wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Wikipedia_mobile_applications when available. The English Wikipedia page is https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Wikipedia_mobile_applications

wiktionary.entries:
The name of a content page on Wiktionary, pluralized.
{{Identical|Entry}}
wiktionary.language-button-text:
Text for the language dropdown button

Should be similar to {{msg-wm|Portals-wiki.language-button-text}}

wikibooks.entries:
The name of a content page on Wikibooks, pluralized.
{{Identical|Page}}

wikinews.entries:
The name of a content page on Wikinews, pluralized.
{{Identical|Article}}

wikiquote.entries:
The name of a content page on Wikiquote, pluralized.
{{Identical|Article}}

wikiversity.entries: The name of a content page on Wikiversity, pluralized.

wikivoyage.entries:
The name of a content page on Wikivoyages, pluralized.
{{identical|Page}}
